meanings.definition: To give a new form or structure to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to refashion her old dress into a trendy skirt.
meanings.sent2: I plan to refashion my room by rearranging the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to refashion a broken vase into a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: With determination, she refashioned her life after facing a difficult challenge.
meanings.sent5: He refashioned the old car into a sleek, modern vehicle.

meanings.definition: To alter or remake clothing or accessories in a new style.
meanings.sent1: She loves to refashion old jeans into stylish shorts.
meanings.sent2: Fashion designers often refashion vintage pieces into modern trends.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to refashion the dress multiple times to get the perfect fit.
meanings.sent4: She refashioned her wardrobe to reflect her evolving personal style.
meanings.sent5: The costume designer refashioned the historical garments for the movie set.
